meanings.definition: To remove from a sphere or circular shape.
meanings.sent1: She carefully unspheres the clay to create a unique sculpture.
meanings.sent2: The artist unspheres the dough to make different shapes of cookies.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child unspheres the neatly arranged toys on the shelf.
meanings.sent4: The storm unspheres the calm surface of the lake, creating ripples.
meanings.sent5: The gardener unspheres the bushes to give them a more natural look.

meanings.definition: To disrupt or disturb the harmony or balance of something.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise unspheres the peaceful atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent2: His unexpected arrival unspheres the carefully planned party.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy unspheres the order in the living room by scattering toys around.
meanings.sent4: The controversial decision unspheres the unity among the team members.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind unspheres the delicate balance of the mobile hanging in the garden.
